Questions.QuestionString: Which purpose of the Pack Discharge Heating Valve(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Add more hot air for increase temperature of pack outlet
Minimum humid and also decrease ice build up
Stop supply from pack when pack overheat

Questions.QuestionString: khoi nao dieu khien ERAI actuator trong truong hop auto:
Answers: ASCU 1
FWD Outflow Valve Control Unit (OCU),
Semi-automatic control unit

Questions.QuestionString: muc dich cua pre-mixer unit:

Questions.QuestionString: when cockpit HI-Vent pushed:
Answers: all electric bypass valve open
restricter valve fully open.
A & B

Questions.QuestionString: when CAX fan running
Answers: A/C energized
A/C on ground and inflight until defined altitude
garlley equipment operates

Questions.QuestionString: which Function of  Supplemental Cooling System (SCS)
Answers: maintains and cooling pack bay compartment​
may cooling for avionic system
maintains at low temperature the air in the trolleys of the galleys

Questions.QuestionString: In avionic vent system. If one extraction fan Inop :
Answers: Both overboard valve and inboard valve fully open
another fan increase speed
overboard valve open and inboard valve fully close

Questions.QuestionString: In avionic vent system. if one blowing fan fails or one CED detects insufficient cooling
Answers: backup valve open on relate side.
both backup valve open
extract fan increase speed.

Questions.QuestionString: when the DITCHING P/B SW set ON, which component will be close:
Answers: FCV, avionic overboard valve, avinonic inboard valve,
RAI door, Out Flow control Valve,
FCV, RAI door, avionic overboard valve, OFV

Questions.QuestionString: which is menthod control temperature in cabin and cockpit:
Answers: supply hot air to distribution duct
use heating by electrical
A&B

Questions.QuestionString: hat is true regarding the operation of Flow Control Valves (FCV) on a PACK?
Answers: Only one operates at a time and controlled by one channel of related ASCU.
Both FCVs operate at a time and controlled by the related ASCU.
Depending on failure condition one or both FCV can operate at a time.

Questions.QuestionString: he PACK1 (2) Reset switch is used to reset:
Answers: ASCU1(2).
ASCU1(2) and the relevant Ventilation Control System (VCS) application.
ASCU1(2) and the related Air Conditioning System (ACS) application .

Questions.QuestionString: hat components are used to control the Pack discharged temperature by the ACSU ?
Answers: RAM Air inlet Door Actuator, Ram Air Outlet Door Actuator and Temperature control Valve
Air Cycle Machine
Pack Discharge Heating Check Valve and Pack Discharge Heating-Valve

Questions.QuestionString: hat is the function of the Pack Discharge Heating Valve ?
Answers: Add more hot air for increase temperature of pack outlet
Stop supply from pack when pack overheat
Minimizing the humidity of the pack outlet air and decreasing the risk of the ice build-up.

Questions.QuestionString: ow does the overboard valve of the Avionic Ventilation System operate?
Answers: On ground the overboard valve is in fully open position.
In flight configuration, the overboard is in the closed position.
Both above

Questions.QuestionString: hat data is used by the ASCU to detect the ice build-up in the condenser?
Answers: The Pack discharged temperature.
The Pack discharged delta pressure.
The water extractor temperature.

Questions.QuestionString: hich is the possible reason if the Pack discharged temperature indication on BLEED Page is abnormally high?
Answers: Failure of Pack Inlet Temperature sensor.
Failure of the Water extractor temperature sensor.
Failure of Pack Discharge Temperature Sensor or misinstallation between Pack Discharge Temperature Sensor and Water Extractor Temperature-Sensor

Questions.QuestionString: n ground in case of compressor outlet temperature or pack discharge temperature exceeding the limit:
Answers: The active FCV is automatically controlled to closed position.
The active FCV is automatically controlled to closed and the adjacent FCV take over.
The active FCV continues to modulate the airflow.

Questions.QuestionString: he Emergency Ram Air Inlet (ERAI) door is controlled open:
Answers: Automatically in case of failure of both Packs and the aircraft in emergency descent configuration.
Manually by pushing the RAM AIR P/B SW and the A/C altitude is less than 10000 feet .
Both above.

Questions.QuestionString: In normal operation of the trim air system:
Answers: The left trim-air pressure-regulating valve and the trim air shut-off valve are open, the right trim-air pressure-regulating valve  closed.
Both the trim-air pressure-regulating valves are open and the trim air shut-off valve closed.
The right trim-air pressure-regulating valve and the trim air shut-off valve are open, the left trim-air pressure-regulating valve  closed.

Questions.QuestionString: The Compartment Air Extraction (CAX) System is controlled by VCS application as follow:
Answers: On the ground, the CAX isolation valve closes and the CAX extraction fan runs.
In flight, the CAX isolation valve opens and the CAX extraction fan stops.
Both above

Questions.QuestionString: What is the purpose of the Interconnection Cable to connect between Ground Service Panel and Ground Service Equipment when filling SCS?
Answers: Supply Electrical power for SCS
Set the SCS from Standby to Servicing Mode
Supply Electrical Power for Ground Service Equipment

Questions.QuestionString: Why is to supply nitrogen gas to SCS Ground Service Equipment when filling SCS ?
Answers: To recharge the Accumulator of SCS.
Using nitrogen Pressure to pressurized filling system
Using nitrogen pressure to push SCS coolant in hose return to Ground Service Equipment Tank

Questions.QuestionString: In normal operation the Avionics Ventilation System (AVS) uses:
Answers: The cargo air to ventilate the avionic equipments.
The cooled fresh air from mixer to ventilate the avionic equipments.
The cooled re-circulated air to ventilate the avionic equipments.

Questions.QuestionString: When the Cabin Pressure Control System (CPCS) operates in AUTO mode:
Answers: Each Outflow Vale Control Unit( OCU) independently controls the related Out Flow Valve( OFV).
The CPCS applications control both OFVs.
The master OCU controls directly its OFV and the other OFV via the slave OCU

Questions.QuestionString: When the Cabin Pressure Control System (CPCS) operates in MANUAL mode:
Answers: Each Outflow Vale Control Unit( OCU) independently controls the related Out Flow Valve( OFV).
The Semi-Automatic Control Unit( SACU) control OFVs via OCUs.
The master OCU control both OFVs

Questions.QuestionString: What is true regarding the operation of the Overpressure Relief Valve?
Answers: It includes a Positive Pressure Relief and also a Negative Pressure Relief feature
It has a Positive Pressure Relief feature only.
It has a Negative Pressure Relief feature only.

Questions.QuestionString: The Conditioned Service Air System (CSAS) is controlled and monitored :
Answers: By the left and right Air Supply Control Units (ASCUs).
By the dedicated CSAS controller.
By the Air Conditioning System (ACS) application.

Questions.QuestionString: The Trim Air Valve can be manually Positioned and locked(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Yes, can be manually positioned and locked 3 positions(Closed, LO, HI Pos)
Yes, Locked 2 positions(Closed, Opened)
Yes, Locked 2 Positions(Closed, LO Position)

Questions.QuestionString: For Filling SCS which purpose of the Interconnection Cable to connect between Ground Service Panel and Ground Service Equipment(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Supply Electrical power for SCS
Set the SCS from Standby to Servicing Mode
Supply Electrical Power for Ground Service Equipment

Questions.QuestionString: Which purpose of nitrogen supply to SCS Ground Service Equipment when filling SCS(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Supply nitrogen for Accumulator of SCS
Using nitrogen Pressure to pressurized filling system
Using nitrogen pressure to push SCS coolant in hose return to Ground Service EquipmentTank

Questions.QuestionString: On the overhead reset panel, when you pull PACK1 (2) Reset Pushbutton this mean reset which(A, B1, B2)
Answers: ASCU1(2)
ASCU1(2) and relate ACS application in CPIOM
ASCU1(2) and ACU1(2)

Questions.QuestionString: For quickly control Pack Outlet Temperature, which component main control by ACSU(A, B1, B2)
Answers: RAM Air inlet Door Actuator and Ram Air Outlet Door Actuator
Temp control Valve
Temp Control Valve and Pack Discharge Heating-Valve

Questions.QuestionString: Which purpose of the Pack Discharge Heating Valve(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Add more hot air for increase temperature of pack outlet
Minimum humid and also decrease ice build up
Stop supply from pack when pack overheat

Questions.QuestionString: For control temperature of pack outlet, which component using by ACSU to get lowest temp demand in mixer(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Water extractor temperature-sensor and pack discharge temperature-sensor.
Pack discharge Temperature sensor and compressor pack discharge sensor
Main Heat exchangerOutlet Temp Sensor and Pack Discharge

Questions.QuestionString: Relate to ASCU? Which answers follow is correct(A, B1, B2)
Answers: ASCU is dual Channel controller, one channel in active mode, one in standby mode
Each ASCU Channel control one FCV
All Above

Questions.QuestionString: Which component take important data for ACSU control pack outlet temperature(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Pack discharge temperature Sensor
Compressor Discharge Temperature-Sensor
Water Extractor Temperature-Sensor

Questions.QuestionString: In flight if packs overheat(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Pack auto shutdown for prevent damaged component
Pack will continue to operated
Depend A/C Attitude

Questions.QuestionString: If pack outlet temperature indication on BLEED Page abnormal high, which of the followings can cause(B1, B2)
Answers: Failure of Pack Inlet Temperature sensor
Failure of Pack Discharge Temperature Sensor or wrong install between Pack Discharge Temperature Sensor and Water Extractor Temperature-Sensor
Failure of the Pack Discharge Temperature Sensor
